Package arcade.patch.agent.process

Class PatchProcessMetabolism

  • java.lang.Object
    • arcade.patch.agent.process.PatchProcess
      • arcade.patch.agent.process.PatchProcessMetabolism
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Process
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PatchProcessMetabolismCART, PatchProcessMetabolismComplex, PatchProcessMetabolismMedium, PatchProcessMetabolismRandom, PatchProcessMetabolismSimple
    public abstract class PatchProcessMetabolism
extends PatchProcess
    Implementation of Process for cell metabolism.

    The PatchProcessMetabolism process:

    • gets available glucose and oxygen from the environment
    • calculates energy consumption (ATP) given cell size and state
    • steps the metabolism process (implemented with different complexities) to determine changes to energy and volume
    • updates glucose and oxygen environment with consumption

    All metabolism complexities use both the glycolysis and oxidative phosphorylation pathways to generate energy. Several stoichiometric ratios for glucose, oxygen, and pyruvate in glycolysis and oxidative phosphorylation are provided. Glucose and oxygen are numbered constants, codes may be added for additional molecules.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PatchProcessMetabolism

        PatchProcessMetabolism​(PatchCell cell)
        Creates a metabolism PatchProcess for the given cell.

        Process parameters are specific for the cell population. Loaded parameters include:

        • BASAL_ENERGY = basal energy requirement
        • PROLIFERATION_ENERGY = additional energy required for proliferation
        • MIGRATION_ENERGY = additional energy required for migration
        • CELL_DENSITY = cell density
        • RATIO_GLUCOSE_BIOMASS = ratio of glucose to biomass
        • OXYGEN_SOLUBILITY_TISSUE = oxygen solubility in tissue

        The process starts with energy at zero and assumes a constant ratio between mass and volume (through density).

        Parameters:
        cell - the PatchCell the process is associated with
